title: settings
description: JSON schema for the configuration of safety-results-over-time
overview:
The most straightforward way to customize the Safety Results Over Time is by using a configuration object whose properties describe the behavior and appearance of the chart. Since the Safety Results Over Time is a Webcharts `chart` object, many default Webcharts settings are set in the [defaultSettings.js file](https://github.com/RhoInc/safety-results-over-time/blob/master/src/defaultSettings.js) as [described below](#webcharts-settings). Refer to the [Webcharts documentation](https://github.com/RhoInc/Webcharts/wiki/Chart-Configuration) for more details on these settings.
In addition to the standard Webcharts settings several custom settings not available in the base Webcharts library have been added to the Safety Results Over Time to facilitate data mapping and other custom functionality. These custom settings are described in detail below. All defaults can be overwritten by users.
data-guidelines: The Safety Results Over Time accepts [JSON](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) data of the format returned by [`d3.csv()`](https://github.com/d3/d3-3.x-api-reference/blob/master/CSV.md). The renderer visualizes clinical medical signs data with **one row per participant per visit per medical sign** plus the required variables specified below.
data-structure: one record per participant per visit per medical sign

id_col.title: ID
id_col.description: name of variable that captures unique identifier of participant

value_col.title: Visit
value_col.description: name of variable that captures visit name

order_col.title: Visit Order
order_col.description: name of variable that captures visit order

measure_col.title: Measure
measure_col.description: name of variable that captures measure name

unit_col.title: Unit
unit_col.description: name of variable that captures measure unit

value_col.title: Result
value_col.description: name of variable that captures measure result

normal_col_low.title: Lower Limit of Normal
normal_col_low.description: name of variable that captures LLN of measure

normal_col_high.title: Upper Limit of Normal
normal_col_high.description: name of variable that captures ULN of measure

start_value.title: Initially Displayed Measure
start_value.description: value of measure to display initially

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: an array of filter variables and associated metadata

groups.title: Groupings
groups.description: an array of grouping variables and associated metadata

boxplots.title: Display box plots?
boxplots.description: controls initial display of box plots

outliers.title: Display outliers?
outliers.description: controls initial display of outliers outside the 5th and 95th percentiles

violins.title: Display violin plots?
violins.description: controls initial display of violin plots

missingValues.title: Missing Values
missingValues.description: an array of strings that identify missing values in both the measure and result variables

visits_without_data.title: Display visits without data?
visits_without_data.description: controls display of visits without data for the current measure

unscheduled_visit_pattern.title: Unscheduled Visit Pattern
unscheduled_visit_pattern.description: a regular expression that identifies unscheduled visits

unscheduled_visit_values.title: Unscheduled Visit List
unscheduled_visit_values.description: an array of strings that identify unscheduled visits; overrides unscheduled_visit_pattern
